main event: A bright blue-white object resembling a star was sighted over Pittsfield and Detroit, Maine, between January 31 and February 8, 1955.
interesting points: The object was described as the size and shape of a four-foot circular saw,It flickered at times but did not explode or give off smoke or exhaust,The object revolved slowly and projected small beams of light, It faded away to a pinpoint at sunrise,Witnesses reported clear weather conditions during the observation.
sighted object: a bright blue-white object resembling a circular saw
